scheme_name: Financial Assistance to Disabled Students Pursuing (10th, 11th, 12th Equivalent Exams)
department: Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala
description: This scheme provides financial assistance to differently abled students in Kerala who have dropped out of school and are pursuing SSLC, +1, or +2 equivalent courses implemented by the State Literacy Mission. The scheme aims to support such students with course fees, exam fees, registration, and admission charges.

eligibility.residency: Applicant must be a resident of Kerala.
eligibility.disability: Applicants must have 40% or more disability.
eligibility.income_category: Both APL and BPL category students are eligible.

steps: Visit nearest Anganwadi Centre or District Social Justice Office and collect the application form, or download it from the official website.
Fill out the application form completely.
Submit the application to the District Social Justice Officers (DSJOs) or the concerned Anganwadi Centre.
application_process.verification: DSJOs will ensure applicants completed the course and received certificates from the State Literacy Mission.
application_process.beneficiary_selection: Based on applications collected by Anganwadi workers and enquiries by Child Development Project Officers (CDPOs).

documents_required: Income Certificate or Copy of Ration Card (if applicable)
